column1: Coal worker's pneumoconiosis is a lung disease that results from breathing in dust from coal, graphite, or man-made carbon over a long time.
Most people with this disease are older than 50.
Smoking does not increase your risk of developing this disease, but it may have an added harmful effect on the lungs.
If coal worker's pneumoconiosis occurs with rheumatoid arthritis, it is called Caplan syndrome.
